UserProfile.title: UserProfile
UserProfile.description: Represents a user's profile on the portfolio website.

name.description: The full name of the user.

title.description: The professional title of the user.

bio.description: A short biography of the user.

Project.title: Project
Project.description: Represents a project showcased on the portfolio.

liveUrl.description: URL to the live project (if available).

repoUrl.description: URL to the project's code repository (e.g., GitHub).

Skill.title: Skill
Skill.description: Represents a skill listed in the portfolio.

name.description: Name of the skill (e.g., React, JavaScript).

Certification.title: Certification
Certification.description: Represents a certification earned by the user.

issuer.description: Issuing authority of the certification (e.g., Coursera, edX).

url.description: URL to validate the certification's authenticity.

ContactFormSubmission.title: ContactFormSubmission
ContactFormSubmission.description: Represents a submission to the contact form

id.description: Unique identifier for the contact form submission

Testimonial.title: Testimonial
Testimonial.description: Represents a testimonial about the user.

author.description: Name of the person giving the testimonial.

authorTitle.description: Title of the person giving the testimonial (e.g., CEO, Manager).

authorCompany.description: Company of the person giving the testimonial.

BlogPost.title: BlogPost
BlogPost.description: Represents a blog post or article.

summary.description: A short summary of the blog post.

content.description: The blog post content (likely HTML or Markdown).

publicationDate.description: Date the blog post was published.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure prioritizes authorization independence and QAPs using denormalization. User profiles, projects, skills, certifications, and blog posts are stored under a user-specific path (`/users/{userId}`). This path-based ownership simplifies security rules and enables secure list operations. Contact form submissions and testimonials are stored in root-level collections, as they have different security needs. The data structure recommendation will also include the use of denormalized fields where appropriate to maintain Authorization Independence, specifically with the UserProfile data.
